content.description:
This problem begins under the roof matched on an undercling.  Climbs through some compression moves until a toss into a pocket (inside a hueco).  4 stars for awesome holds, movement, landing and obvious line.   

  Beta:  Start  matched on the undercling and squeeze between two opposing feet.  Through out right hand to an undercling and toss again for a 90 degree angled sloper.  Right foot over to compress on a heel hook down and right of your hand.  Bump left hand into a bad pinch eight inches from the starting hold and switch your left foot from a heel hook on the starting hold to a good toe hook.  Sag.  Match the other 90 degree hold right next to your left hand.  Switch the right heel hook to pushing with your toe and do a dynamic move to the lip, you will begin to cut feet and swing out desperately so very quickly swing your right hand to an undercling a foot (back) into the cave.  Heel hook up and match the large hueco.  (This is the beginning of Try Hard FA Ricky O V5).  Cross into an undercling pinch at the top of the hueco and left hand to a decent crimp.  Switch you heel to a toe and surge up to a good but hard to hold hueco.  Match your right foot to your left and toe hook the right undercling by your hand, reach up (slowly... slowly...) to a jug on the lip rock over.
content.location: As you approach the Central Dragon's Den (Hobbit Boulder?) you will walk underneath a roof (on that same boulder).  Try Harder is that roof.

content.description: The stand start to Try Harder. Big moves on sloping huecos above a huge undercut roof.
Sit start in the middle of the Sweat Loaf boulder. Follow the fun huecos up, and make a big move left for the classic finish. Topout is probably easier than Satan, Satan, Satan.
content.protection: One pad for topout. There is a boulder behind it that follows you up, so you can just step back if you want.
content.location: Same boulder as Rembrandt Pussyhorse, maybe 6' right. Look for good huecos at the bottom, and a huge hueco up near the top. Either downclimb to the right or walk around to the left to hop back down.

content.description: A short problem. Start matched in a slot (difficult for those with larger fingers). Make a couple deadpoints to reach the lip. Top out.
content.location: Located on the left side of the overhanging face shared by Notorious D.I.G.

content.description: Really fun line of huecos on the far right side of the wall with Rembrandt Pussyhorse. Start as low as you can in the huecos and go straight up. The topout is the crux.
content.protection: One pad for topout. There is a boulder behind it that follows you up, so you can just step back if you want.
content.location: Same wall as Sweat Loaf and Rembrandt Pussyhorse. Either downclimb to the right or walk around to the left to hop back down.

content.description: Left most climb on the Sweat Loaf boulder, move up through opposing sidepulls or theres a couple good crimps as options too.
content.protection: wall runs behind you so its pretty safe, maybe have someone pull a pad up as you climb if your worried about your hands popping b4 your feet.
content.location: Left most climb on the Sweat Loaf boulder. get down where satan satan satan topsout (rightmost climb on Sweat Loaf)

content.description: Starts on a huge flake with the crux being the toss to the left after the flake ends.
This problem starts on two crimps and does a lock off move to a odd incut pocket.  High right foot, hit the gaston and jump with the right hand to the lip.
content.location: If you are at the Dragon's Den and are facing the Hobbit in a Blender go around (the way you came from) under the roof (Try Harder) and walk 50 yards across a small meadow down and right from Try Harder.  The problem is on a boulder on your left.

content.description: Stand start to Full Service.
The rightmost problem of the 3 on this face of the boulder.  Make sure you have a good spotter because of the boulder behind you.
Sit start with a low left hand. Sharp and uncomfortable holds, but the movement ain't bad. Only worth getting on if you've already done the other climbs...

This problem named in honor of the park ranger Hector, starts in Ides of March and ends to the left on Brutus. Hector always said he climbed and he understood climbers and what we were about, nice generalization since all climbers are definitly the same. Sometimes it's an honor to be put in a blender and sometimes not, Hobbit, Brittney, Alf etc. we'll leave this open to interpretation. 

  From the start of Ides of March make thin, long moves up and left into the middle of Brutus. The holds are particularly thin and sharp but is worth doing if you've already done Ides and Brutus.

A great problem with a tough opening move and a comitting move up higher to a cool mantle. The start holds are reputedly chipped out to be better, though there is so much chalk on them now that it is hard to tell though it seems plausible. 

  Start on the two positive crimps and get one foot or the other on and bust a move out right to gaston at the bottom of the crack. Get a foot up near the start holds and fall in to match in the crack. Layback up a move or two and make a long move up to a jug at the top of the crack. You can top out straight up but it is better to do another long move out right to another jug and hand foot match on the first and mantle from here up to some edges on the face above.

This is the original V10 at Hueco (the standard for V10, in fact), and it is still considered by many to be the best. It was one of the most sought after ticks in the '90's and it still is for that matter.

 John Sherman originally envisioned the line and had done the stand, Lip Service, when Dale Goddard sent the full rig, calling it "Serves You Right." However, Sherman's name, "Full Service," seems to have stuck.
Aka Wet Dock? Start matched on the lower undercling (where your feet go for Dry Dock) and finish Dry Dock.
Crux is either the first move or the top out if you are figuring it out on the fly.  Many believe this hard for the grade.  This problem is SICK!!!!!
content.protection: Pads are a must as there is a small boulder below the landing
content.location: In the Dragon's Den, Dry Dock is the hanging prow left of Full Service.  Linking Full Service into Dry Dock is Full Throttle (V13)

climbs.name: Dragonfly Low AKA: Fish on a Stick

content.description:
Start below the good left facing flake on Dragonfly, on pretty good underclings.  Smear your feet and make either a long move right up to the start hold on dragonfly, or bump to a bad sidepull then to the starting hold on dragonfly.  Finish up Dragonfly. 

  Probably a gimme at the grade.
content.protection: Pads and spotters for the finish of Dragonfly
content.location: Sit start to Dragonfly on Hardman Rock in the South Dragon's Den.  Across from the classics Dry Dock and Full Service.

content.description:
Once and still considered a mega-classic. Follow the left angling flake crack with good holds that are quite spaced and bad feet to its end on a monster jug. Make a huge move out left to an OK hold, heal hook right and go right hand to a gaston. Then swing the feet left to another heal and go to a left hand gaston, step up and top out. 

  Alternately, go the the right hand gaston with the left hand as a side pull and make a big move straight up the blunt prow over a worse landing for a slightly harder and more direct finish. Seems to be rarely done, but it is actually quite good especially if you've done the original finish multiple times. 

Location

  Just left of Dry Dock around the corner following the sweet left arching flake/crack.
content.protection: crash pads and spotters, if you do the right finish you may want a few more pads as the landing zone then includes the rock shelf that everyone tends to sit on behind the problem.

content.description:
Recommend taping your tips on this one. 

  From the sit, grab a few razor blades and a good pinch on the arete. Then move to a left hand hold that is just a tooth. Move up onto improving holds and into the crack. Follow the crack up and right to top out. 

  Fun climbing where you actually work the arete. You always have a hand and foot on each side.
content.location: The steep arete left of Brutus from a sit down start.

content.description:
While not quite as classic as some of the other V5's in the area (Dragon Fly, AKA: Dogmaticsand Hobbit in a Blender), this one is still worthy of some skin. 

  Starts just right of the thin arete Crimping Christ on a Cross on a positive flake about 7 ft off the ground.  Pull off the ground and make a few difficult moves up side pulls and crimps to an easy top out.
content.location: Starts just right of the steep arete Crimping Christ on a Cross.  Leftmost route on the face of the boulder.  About 30ft up the hill from Hobbit in a Blender.

content.description:
A very pretty problem, with unique holds and puzzling movement. 

  Sit start on an obvious slopey shelf and go straight up using edges, underclings, a very slopey pod, and some kneebar trickery until you reach two very small, sharp crimps on the lip of the roof.  Mantle up and left over a slightly scary slab.  Hence the PG13.
content.location: On the North side of the Hobbit in a Blender boulder.

climbs.name: Black, White, and Red All Over

content.description:
Black, White, and Red All Over is not as classic as some of the other climbs in the area but certainly worth a try. 

       Start on a low crimpy rail and pull a few hard moves to an slightly chossy top out.
content.location: Black, White, and Red All Over is on the arÃªte just to the left of Try Harder.

content.description: Probably one of the top 3 most trafficed areas before the guided access restrictions. With great problems in the mid-range from V2 or so to V7, sadly you are not allowed to climb on several of the boulders even when on a tour (the 3 bimbos) which makes the area a little more limited but still quite popular. Classics include the Oseter problems V2 and 3, Hobbit V5, Dragonfly V5, Dry Dock V7++, Full Service V10 and many others that are worth doing when in the area. Truly there is something for everyone at the Dragon's Den.
